CHAT.comment: at the start of the recording June and her mother are reading a book. June is sitting on her mother's knee , her mother is sitting in the center of the floor. the book is Pinnochio.
note that June is highly uncooperative for the first 170 lines and the text contains long passages during which her mother is reading to her from the book.

u.a: June cries and shakes her head at the new book .
mother holds up the toy rabbit .
June lies on the floor and cries .
June gets back on her mother's knee .
mother gets another book and points to a picture in it .
June cries and lies on the floor .
mother picks a clothes pin up , from the floor and hands it to June .
June hands the pin back to her mother .
mother offers the pin back to June .
mother plays with the pin and pretends to bite June's nose with it .
June drops the pin on the floor .
points to the picture in the book
mother gets another book from the bookshelf , this also has a picture of a train on the front of it .
June picks up the new book and sits on her mother's knee again .
mother points to a different picture in the book .
June ignores her mother and continues to turn the pages
silence during which June turns the pages of the book .
silence during which mother searches for the mothergoose book and looks for the correct rhyme .
June points to the book that she is holding .
mother gets a book of animals
no referent , unless it's the roundness of the chick .
picture shows a dog and a cat .
June walks towards the toybox , mother holds up a toy parrot .
mother lifts the toybox into the viewing area .
June pushes the box as mother pulls .
silence during which mother opens up the shapesorter and June drops a sucker into it , June then closes the shapesorter and hands it to her mother .
very quietly and very high pitch .
June picks a shape out of the shapesorter .
June hands the shapesorter to her mother
June wanders across to the microphone and begins to play with it
mother begins to get some books out of the toybox
June turns to the microphone and pulls it from the stand , Roy replaces it .
June picks the seashore book out of the toybox
June unfolds the book and gives it to her mother .
no response so mother turns the book over .
mother references a part of the book by nodding at it , both her hands are occupied with holding up the unfolded book .
June is sucking on her fingers .
mother picks up a toy rabbit .
June is now holding both toys .
mother turns the skirt on the wolf toy so that it now looks like grandma .
mother gets a cloth book and shows June a picture of an apple .
June acts out her explanation , first she puts the rabbit on the floor .
June uses the cloth book like a blanket to cover the rabbit .
June hands the rabbit to her mother , mother hugs it and rocks it .
June wraps the rabbit in the cloth book .
June gives the rabbit to her mother
June hugs the rabbit , mother gets the building blocks out of the toybox .
June puts the rabbit down on the blocks
June tosses the rabbit at her mother .
silence during which June hugs the rabbit while her mother tidies up the toys .
June wanders off into the kitchen .
mother brings June back into the viewing area .
mother sings and June begins to twirl slowly .
June moves to a less cluttered area of the floor and keeps on twirling .
mother picks up Potatohead and begins to reassemble him
June begins to take Potatohead apart , beginning with the pipe .
June touches first the ear and then the hat
she hands the Potatohead to her mother
June puts the hat on Potatohead .
June picks up an ear and puts that in instead .
June puts the pipe in the mouth .
June takes Potatohead from her mother and drops him on the floor .
June picks up Potatohead and then she picks up the mouth and the pipe .
June puts the mouth in upside down .
June puts the pipe in upside down to match the mouth .
June attempts to put the ear in and fails , she cries and hands the Potatohead to her mother .
mother holds the Potatohead while June puts in the ear .
June once again fails to put the mouth in and cries .
June stands up with the other shoe and puts it on .
June has a problem putting the hat on and cries .
June puts the Potatohead on the floor and begins to play with it .
June has problems with the hat , cries again and then succeeds .
June holds Potatohead up to mother and cries .
Potatohead's mouth is in upside down .
June is engrossed in playing with Potatohead .
June has some difficulties with the pipe and gives a frustrated cry . no response
June hands the Potatohead minus the mouth to her mother .
June holds the mouth and attempts to put it in
June gets frustrated , gives up and cries .
June looks around for the pipe , mother helps
June puts the other mouth in Potatohead which means that the pipe won't fit because there's no hole for it . silence .
June reaches out and takes the pipe from her mother .
the absence of the hole means that June is once again frustrated , she cries .
June replaces it with the correct mouth , mother touches June's shoes .
mother digs into the toybox and produces a sock
June looks at the sock for a while before answering
June touches the shoe on Potatohead
points to a picture of an apple in a book on the floor
mother confirms it even though it is wrong .
mother points to another picture , note that it cannot be identified by the observer .
June looks at the stumps where Potatohead's shoes should go and tries to stand it up on them . silence .
silence during which June wraps Potatohead in the cloth book .
silence during which June unwraps Potatohead and begins to reassemble it , she gives a short cry and then hands Potatohead to her mother . then she attempts to put the hat on it .
she fails to locate the hat and hands it to her mother also .
June touches the hole in Potatohead , tries again without success and cries .
June puts the hat in her mother's hand
June holds Potatohead up to her mother
puts the hat in the hole
silence during which June begins to reassemble Potatohead .
June picks up a small white shape that resembles a bath tub
